title: Millwright
description:
ASR Group is the world’s largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar, with an annual production capacity of more than 6 million tons of sugar. The company produces a full line of grocery, industrial, food service and specialty sweetener products. Across North America, ASR Group owns and operates six sugar refineries, located in Louisiana, New York, California, Maryland, Canada and Mexico. In the European Union, the company owns and operates sugar refineries in England, Portugal. ASR Group also owns and operates mills in Mexico and Belize. The company’s brand portfolio includes the leading brands Domino®, C&H®, Redpath®, Tate & Lyle®, Lyle’s® and Sidul®.

Overview

The Millwright works under the direction of Maintenance Supervisor to make sure equipment in their assigned area is kept in top running condition. 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

 Responsible for providing maintenance services through the refinery.  Performs mechanical trouble shooting and repairs.  Perform routine and preventative maintenance services, including troubleshooting, mechanical repairs, rigging, metal fabrication and repairs (welding/burning), pipe installation and repairs, and building crafts work.  Perform cleaning and lubrication on mechanical equipment.  Work with other refinery maintenance and operations personnel to handle normal everyday problems.  Will be assigned to one of the maintenance groups, which include: refinery maintenance, warehouse, pipe/metal, building crafts, garage and raw sugar maintenance.  Reliable and Predictable In-Person Attendance  Able to work overtime on a daily and weekly basis 

Requirements

 Job Requirements 

 Ability to work overtime, rotating shifts and weekends on a regular basis  Have a high regard and ownership for personal safety and the safety of others.  Ability to perform tasks wearing required PPE such as protective clothing, safety glasses/goggles, steel-toed boots, etc.  Ability to work as part of a team in a unionized environment. 

Education

 Education and/or Experience 

 At least 5 years of experience in industrial maintenance or service organization. 

Hourly Rate

 $37.97 

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Project Manager
description:
Are you looking for a career in a rewarding environment that values initiative? Craftworks USA specializes in architectural woodworking and cabinetry and since 2000 we have provided clients with exceptional service, delivering quality millwork and interior furnishing solutions. Building on the success of these relationships, we are continuing to expand. Our teams enjoy the challenges of fast paced construction and the opportunity to creatively solve problems to provide projects on time with exceptional quality. Do you have a passion for success? Do you like the opportunity for growth? If so, we would love to hear from you!

We are located just outside Pittsburgh, PA in a full-service 52,000 sq. ft. facility with the capability to design, budget, fabricate, ship, and install a variety of materials and custom features nationwide. Maintaining our state-of-the-art woodworking tools and software ensures both precision and speed for our client’s most complex jobs. We are proud to deliver high quality craftsmanship and while also being able to meet or exceed fast paced construction schedules. Our nationwide service has expanded to providing full architectural woodwork packages to general contractors, construction managers, and directly to Owners. We have established a lengthy repeat client list and solid reputation for quality, on-time delivery with competitive pricing. Craftworks USA is AWI-QCP and FSC Certified.

Responsibilities

We are seeking an experienced project manager to join our team in Oakdale, PA. This position will be responsible for management of the full cycle of millwork projects from estimating handoff through fabrication to successful installation, including:

Understanding and facilitating execution of full scope of projectsReading and interpreting architectural drawings and specificationsDevelopment and maintenance of project budget to ensure profitable completionReview and coordination of shop drawings and product data submittalsInterpreting project schedules to building and maintain fabrication/installation schedulesSourcing and coordination of materials and subcontractorsPreparing and releasing documents for internal fabrication and shippingMaintaining owner/client relations

What You Will Need To Be Successful

 (3) years’ experience relative to millwork or similar manufactured products, preferred but not required. Must have the ability to read drawings and interpret specifications. Analytical skills and strong attention to detail. Computer skills required – Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook) Be motivated and self-driven while progressing in a team environment. Must be able to work well in an office and shop environment. Ability to master understanding of basic construction methods regarding architectural millwork. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Be highly organized and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.

Craftworks USA is a subsidiary of Rycon Construction, Inc.

At Rycon Construction, Inc. we believe outstanding employees build the foundation necessary for excellence in business. It is with this belief that we are always looking for the best qualified and most talented employees to become part of our team. Rycon offers advancement opportunities along with an excellent salary and benefits package that includes, medical, dental, vision, ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) and 401(k). Qualified candidates will be required to submit to a background screening upon acceptance of an offer.

Rycon Construction Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
